	Type=""

	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	width=""
	expanded="true"
	ariaDescribedBy=""
	ariaLabelledBy=""
	selectedItem=""
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup=""
	itemSelect="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<items></items><!-- sap.tnt.NavigationListItem -->
</NavigationList>
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: The NavigationList control is an interactive control, which provides a choice of different items, ordered as a list.
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.tnt.NavigationList
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NavigationList. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.tnt.NavigationListItem[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getSelectedItem selectedItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.tnt.NavigationListItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:itemSelect itemSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<items></items><!-- sap.tnt.NavigationListItem -->
	<_expandIconControl></_expandIconControl><!-- sap.ui.core.Icon -->
</NavigationListItem>
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: The NavigationListItem control represents an action, which can be selected by the user. It can provide sub items.
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.tnt.NavigationListItem
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NavigationListItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHasExpander hasExpander} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.tnt.NavigationListItem[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Item#constructor sap.ui.core.Item} can be used as well.

<SideNavigation
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	metadataContexts=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	expanded="true"
	selectedItem=""
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup=""
	itemSelect="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<item></item><!-- sap.tnt.NavigationList -->
	<fixedItem></fixedItem><!-- sap.tnt.NavigationList -->
	<footer></footer><!-- sap.tnt.NavigationList -->
	<_topArrowControl></_topArrowControl><!-- sap.ui.core.Icon -->
	<_bottomArrowControl></_bottomArrowControl><!-- sap.ui.core.Icon -->
</SideNavigation>
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The SideNavigation control is a container, which consists of flexible and fixed parts on top of each other.

Responsive Behavior

  • The flexible part adapts its size to the fixed one.
  • The flexible part has a scrollbar when the content is larger than the available space.
Note: In order for the SideNavigation to stretch properly, its parent layout control should only be the sap.tnt.ToolPage.
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.tnt.SideNavigation
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SideNavigation. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItem item} : sap.tnt.NavigationList (default)
    • {@link #getFixedItem fixedItem} : sap.tnt.NavigationList
    • {@link #getFooter footer} : sap.tnt.NavigationList
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedItem selectedItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.tnt.NavigationListItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:itemSelect itemSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<ToolHeader
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	metadataContexts=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	width=""
	active="false"
	enabled="true"
	height=""
	design="Auto"
	ariaLabelledBy=""
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup=""
	press="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<content></content><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
	<_overflowButton></_overflowButton><!-- sap.m.ToggleButton -->
	<_popover></_popover><!-- sap.m.Popover -->
</ToolHeader>
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The ToolHeader control is a horizontal container that is most commonly used to display buttons, labels, and other various input controls.

Overview

The ToolHeader control is based on {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar}. It contains clearly structured menus of commands that are available across the various apps within the same tool layout.

Usage

  • If an app implements side navigation in addition to the tool header menu, the menu icon must be the first item on the left-hand side of the tool header.
  • The app menu and the side navigation must not have any dependencies and must work independently.
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.tnt.ToolHeader

</ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator>
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: The ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator control is used in the sap.tnt.ToolHeader control to specify where the overflow button is placed.
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.tnt.ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription: Constructor for a new ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<ToolPage
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	metadataContexts=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	sideExpanded="true"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<header></header><!-- sap.tnt.ToolHeader -->
	<sideContent></sideContent><!-- sap.tnt.SideNavigation -->
	<mainContents></mainContents><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
</ToolPage>
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The ToolPage is a layout control, used to create a basic tools app that has a header, side navigation and contents area.

Overview

The control has three main areas - a header on top, navigation to the side and a content are that can hold any control. The header and side navigation use custom controls - {@link sap.tnt.ToolHeader} and {@link sap.tnt.SideNavigation}.

Usage

The main usage for the asp.tnt controls is for scenarios in the tooling or administration space.
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.tnt.ToolPage
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ToolPage. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSideExpanded sideExpanded} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getHeader header} : sap.tnt.ToolHeader
    • {@link #getSideContent sideContent} : sap.tnt.SideNavigation
    • {@link #getMainContents mainContents} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
